factors.description: Completes well-scoped tasks with moderate supervision, demonstrates consistency and reliability, and begins managing small tasks independently with a focus on learning efficiency.
Executes tasks with partial guidance
Has a direct impact on work outcomes
Meets deadlines, reports issues promptly, and manages time effectively
Builds and maintains internal networks
Can independently manage workload with limited information, requiring only minimal adjustments from their supervisor
Always prepared, able to propose and execute next steps
Executes tasks quickly with limited guidance and independently drives small-scale projects or teams
Regularly reviews and adjusts work plans as needed
Executes quickly with limited guidance and independently drives mid-scale projects or teams
Creates solid work plans and efficiently delegates tasks to others
Executes quickly with limited guidance and independently drives mid-scale projects or teams
Recognized by peers as a central figure in projects, capable of understanding and acting on multifaceted perspectives
Executes quickly with limited guidance and independently drives large-scale projects or teams
Understands how to manage people effectively even amid changes or shifting conditions, and uses team resources efficiently
Recognized by members as a central figure in cross-functional projects, able to move things forward with a strong grasp of multiple perspectives
Executes quickly with limited guidance and independently manages complex, multi-disciplinary projects
Recognized by team members as a central figure in cross-functional projects, able to drive progress with a well-rounded perspective
Identifies and pursues the best path forward with limited information, and drives planning on a realistic timeline
Influences peers within immediate team, communicates progress effectively, and seeks guidance for decision-making while contributing ideas.
Supports team members proactively, identifies opportunities to guide peers, and starts taking responsibility for small initiatives.
Demonstrates leadership on projects within the team, mentors junior members, and drives accountability and positive team dynamics.
Involves their supervisor and influences decisions at the GrM level or above
Consistently provides thoughtful, constructive, and actionable feedback
Recognizes individual personality differences and collaborates effectively in a way that suits each person
Involves GrMs and Directors, and influences decisions at the Director level or higher
Supports junior members by providing feedback and clearly communicating expectations to help them succeed
Involves Directors and Executives, and influences decisions at the executive level or higher
Manages team members who may lack motivation and require support
Frequently involves Directors and Executives, including those from other departments, and influences decisions at the executive level or higher
Delivers constructive 360-degree feedback with sensitivity to individual traits
Further motivates high performers and helps maintain and enhance overall team satisfaction
Frequently involves Directors and Executives across departments and influences decisions at the executive level or higher
Manages low-motivation members who require support, both within and outside the team
Independently delivers production-quality code, follows best practices, and begins contributing to design discussions and documentation.
Leads the development of medium-complexity features, reviews others' work constructively, and ensures quality through testing and validation.
Develop programs that ensure maintainability, including future scalability and ease of modification
Understand the adopted application architecture (e.g., Clean Architecture) and develop new features in alignment with the intent of the framework in use
Identify the impact of modifications to existing features and conduct necessary testing
Design database tables with awareness of anti-patterns
Design tables with performance considerations, selecting appropriate normalization/denormalization strategies based on requirements
Determine the appropriate microservice placement for new features during development
Provide essential and meaningful feedback in code reviews
Write SQL queries with performance optimization in mind
Design and implement features with operational considerations
Independently troubleshoot and resolve complex production errors
Understand and apply the development policy
Comprehend the overall infrastructure of the product and explain it to others
Share insights gained from work externally.
Able to perform refactoring across the entire codebase
Able to lead domain design for large-scale, high-complexity projects and effectively explain it to stakeholders
Able to design using asynchronous messaging while considering inter-component communication and eventual consistency
Able to understand domain context boundaries when developing new features and determine the appropriate placement of functionalities, including whether microservices should be used
Able to design safe release procedures, such as phased rollouts based on feature scale
Able to review table designs and infrastructure architecture
Able to analyze execution plans and optimize SQL performance
Able to improve performance using frontend technologies (e.g., code splitting, SSR/CSR selection, CDN utilization)
Able to understand development policies and propose improvements
Able to understand development policies and reinforce them within the team through reviews
Able to assess application architecture suited for microservices and explain it to stakeholders
Able to comprehend the overall infrastructure of the product and suggest improvements
Able to drive improvements in their area of technical expertise.
Able to develop features that require advanced technical expertise
Able to develop libraries with a focus on reusability
Able to assess and determine the appropriate level of reusability based on service conditions
Able to understand SLI/SLO principles and maintain the reliability of applications in operation
Able to lead improvements in development policies
Able to establish mechanisms for writing maintainable code
Able to establish mechanisms for writing secure code
Able to design and implement CI/CD automation strategies
Able to lead infrastructure improvements
Able to share insights on adopted technologies both internally and externally.
Architects scalable systems across domains, mentors others in setting technical direction, and drives alignment with business and engineering goals.
Able to formulate organization-wide development policies aligned with the product phase
Able to design architectures tailored to the organizational structure and product phase
Able to take ownership of designing the overall product architecture and domain model
Able to select infrastructure with an ROI-conscious approach based on the product phase
Able to share structured expertise related to work with external audiences.
Estimate the development time at the task level
Break down assigned work into smaller tasks, share them with the team, and make final decisions
Leads planning for feature development, ensures timelines are met, and facilitates collaboration across team members.
Plan and prioritize your tasks effectively, ensuring deadlines are met
Report task progress appropriately and consult others to resolve issues when they arise
Understand the basic flow of a project and be aware of dependencies, such as the critical path
When developing multiple related stories (on a 2-3 week scale) with another person, lead the collaboration to ensure efficient development
Plan and execute projects within the team
Manage schedules and resources while tracking team members' progress
Identify potential risks and consider solutions
Make necessary adjustments within the group to achieve project goals
Recognize skill differences among project members and facilitate appropriate collaboration
Provide insights on feasibility and development timelines when translating the Product Manager's vision into a system
Coordinate tasks across multiple projects and teams, optimizing priorities
Monitor overall group progress and make necessary course corrections
Collaborate with stakeholders to manage expectations
Estimate the resources needed for project execution and ensure completion as planned
Make strategic decisions to eliminate unnecessary features to achieve service milestones
Able to coordinate group-wide projects, optimize priorities, and continuously maximize group outcomes
Able to determine response strategies for unforeseen project issues and lead efforts, including resource allocation
Able to facilitate collaboration with other groups to enhance overall organizational productivity
Able to drive process improvements and foster a strong team culture
Able to manage and align department-wide projects, optimize priorities, and continuously maximize departmental outcomes
Able to design a talent portfolio that aligns with business strategy
